head.title: Dec. 26 - Jan. 1; A Coup in Ivory Coast

hedline.hl1: Dec. 26 - Jan. 1; A Coup in Ivory Coast

block.p: Ever since it achieved independence from France in 1960, Ivory Coast has been considered a model of stability and prosperity in Africa. So it came as a shock, both in Africa and in France, when soldiers mutinying over low pay went on a looting spree and, one day later, a military junta announced a coup, the first in the country's history.
The leader of the nonviolent coup, Gen. Robert Guei, a former armed forces chief ousted by President Henri Konan Bedie, said he took action largely because Mr. Bedie was creating ethnic divisions.
